page.title: 01LANDSCAPE MARKFIELD 04480309
page.content: The village of Markfield is situated 7 miles to the N.W. of Leicester. It lies on the S.W. extremity of the ancient Charnwood Forest.First settlers were peasant farmers but from 1800 framework knitting was an additional occupation.The working of igneous rocks at Markfield began at the beginning of the 19th Century and by 1830 Syerite was being quarried.The original quarry has been exhausted but another working a mile from the village still provides local employment.The population of 5000 is served by a primary school,a secondary school,a doctor's surgery,chemist, supermarkets,hairdressers and three churches together with five public houses which make it a self-sufficient village.Communications are good as the village lies on the A50 and there is an M1 link a mile away.
